jobPostingInfo.title: Manufacturing Specialist III
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

This unique opportunity is part of the Mechanical Systems Engineering, Fabrication and Test Division which engages in research, technology development, and the creation of advanced mechanical, thermal, propulsion, and electronic packaging systems with expertise that spans the full breath of mechanical disciplines and is applied from architectural concept development through operations.

As the Manufacturing Specialist you will be working for JPL's Mechanical Fabrication and Test Section which maintains technical support facilities and resources that provide the services required to fabricate, assemble, and test electro-mechanical developmental and flight hardware.  This Section develops and matures equipment and technologies, which enable and enhance our fabrication and environmental test capability for current and future missions.   

Responsibilities:

  • Perform manufacturing engineering functions for the development of mechanical hardware
  • Establish and maintain interfaces with multiple JPL customers 
  • Collaborate with cognizant engineers/customers on hardware design features to improve manufacturability 
  • Utilization of JPL’s Integrated Master Schedule (IMS) software for preplanning fabrication activities
  • Support the process of locating, evaluating, and establishing new vendors as a laboratory resource in fabrication and supply chain
  • Plan, initiate and monitor hardware fabrication activities 
  • Participate in "Make or Buy" decisions, interface with outside vendors 
  • Utilize multiple modules in the Oracle Discrete Manufacturing suite of programs, to develop the implementation plan, monitor the work, estimate WIP, monitor the technical progress of the work and resolve any technical, cost or schedule issues as they arise, capture build history and close process documentation
  • Adhere to strict attendance guidelines
  • Attend weekly Manufacturing Engineering group meetings
  • Work with Cognizant Engineers in the development of precision hardware for an assortment of applications on various projects
  • Perform Ad-hoc assignments as directed

Required Skills:

  • Bachelors in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering or related technical discipline with 6 years of related experience or Masters with 4 years of related experience or PhD with 2 years of related experience.
  • Must have spacecraft hardware development, manufacturing or assembly experience. Including ability to:
    • Evaluate the Design for Manufacturability (DFM) components and changes recommended.
    • Develop, maintain and prepare instructions and sequences for the fabrication and assembly of products
    • Sources and evaluates state-of-the-practice fab and assembly equipment
    • Demonstrated ability to lead a team and enable them to effectively deliver engineering planning, programing, fixture design and process manufacturing plans in a timely manner.
    • Ability to effectively interact with line and project management
    • Strong communication skills and ability to work with suppliers.
    • Experience in JPL policies and procedures, best practices, and methodologies related to the above core technical areas.
    • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and be able to work independently with minimal supervision.
    • Develop estimating and planning that maximize manufacturing approaches for current in-house fabrication designs.

Desired Skills:

  • Experience in CNC programming utilizing state of the art CAM software, MasterCAM, NX, Esprit.
  • Solid Modeling
  • Experience in the following process improvement initiatives, Lean Manufacturing/ Kaizen/ Six Sigma/ 5-X.
  • Experience planning (storyboarding) and executing mechanical assembly activities.
  • Prefer a minimum of 6 years prior experience in manufacturing engineering of Aerospace products. An in depth understanding of critical equipment handling sequences.
  • Proven ability to take verbal and incomplete design elements and recommending to engineering personnel solutions for the manufacture and assembly of prototype hardware.
  • Highly energized, self-motivated, with the ability to work on several assignments that are complex in nature using considerable practical judgment.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
